info.title: TrueWay VRP
info.description: Solving the vehicle routing problem (multi-vehicle route optimization).
info.x-long-description:
This API is designed to solve the main task of logistics - Vehicle Routing Problem (VRP).
The Vehicle Routing Problem (VRP) is the challenge of designing optimal routes for multiple vehicles visiting a set of locations(orders) each with business-specific constraints, such as vehicle limitations, cost controls, time windows, resource limitations concerning the loading process at the depot, etc.
When there's only one vehicle, it reduces to the Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP).
This API effectively solves most variations of this problem:
- Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP).
- Capacitated Vehicle Routing Problem (CVRP)
- Vehicle Routing Problem with time windows (VRPTW)
- Multi-depot Vehicle Routing Problem (MDVRP)
- Open Vehicle Routing Problem (OVRP)
- Site Dependent Vehicle Routing Problem (SDVRP)
- Heterogeneous Fleet Vehicle Routing Problem (HFVRP)
This API can also solve any mix of the above problem types.

The API allows you to:
- Improve your fleet utilization by finding a cost-effective stop sequence to service your locations(orders).
- Solving the complicated vehicle routing problem between multiple locations for a full fleet of vehicles, taking into account various restrictions.

parameters.name: max_vehicle_driving_duration
parameters.description: Vehicle maximum route driving duration (seconds). Not include service or wait times. Default: 0 (Unlimited)

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Start time (seconds since 01/01/1970 00:00:00 or seconds since 01/01/0001 00:00:00 or 0 - current time in UTC). Default: 0 (UTC Now)

parameters.name: max_vehicle_orders
parameters.description: Maximum allowable number of orders on the vehicle. Default: 0 (Unlimited)

parameters.name: max_vehicle_waiting_duration
parameters.description: Vehicle maximum waiting duration at order (seconds). Default: 0 (Unlimited)

parameters.name: shipment_delivery_precedence
parameters.description:
Shipment(pickup and delivery) deliveries precedence:
- `any`
- `fifo`
- `lifo`
Default: `any`

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description:
Optimization quality:
- `fast`
- `normal`
- `best` *(for paid plans only)*
Default: `normal`

parameters.name: vehicle_capacity
parameters.description: Default vehicle capacity. A comma-separated string containing the default vehicles capacities. For simple nonamed one-dimensional capacity, it's just an integer. For named or multidimensional capacity, this is an array of comma-separated pairs `dimension_name:dimension_capacity`, for example "`weight:10,volume:20`".

post.description: Solves a vehicle routing problem (VRP) to find the best routes for a fleet of vehicles.

address.description: The address of the order location

oneOf.description: The size of the order (quantities for delivery). You can specify size in any dimension, such as weight, volume, or quantity. You can even specify multiple dimensions, for example, weight and volume. For example: "quantity":10, "quantity":{"weight":10,"volume":20}

service_duration.description: The duration of the service (service time) in seconds, i.e. how long it takes at the customer site.

operating_duration.description: Duration of longest route (seconds) i.e. duration of the entire solution

delivery_quantity.description: Quantities for delivery on the route

address.description: The address of the end location

cumul_distance.description: Traveled distance upon arrival at this location (meters)

cumul_driving_duration.description: Driving duration upon arrival at this location (seconds)

cumul_duration.description: Traveled duration upon arrival at this location (seconds)

description.description: The description of the end location

name.description: The name of the end location

pickup_quantity.description: Quantities for pickup on the route

shipment_quantity.description: Quantities for shipment on the route

address.description: The address of the start location

description.description: The description of the start location

name.description: The name of the start location

vehicle_id.description: Id of vehicle that operates route

cumul_distance.description: Traveled distance upon arrival at this location (meters)

cumul_driving_duration.description: Cumulated driving duration upon arrival at this location (seconds)

cumul_duration.description: Cumulated travel duration upon arrival at this location (seconds)

cumul_load.description: Load upon arrival at this location

order_id.description: Id of the order performed at this location

total_duration.description: Total travel duration for all routes (seconds)

unassigned_orders.description: Array of ids of unassigned orders that could not be served

Extended Delivery.description: Complex Delivery with multidimensional capacity constraints, distance and duration constraints, time windows, working hours, breaks, ...

address.description: The address of the order location

max_time_in_vehicle.description: The maximum time a order can stay in the vehicle (seconds)

priority.description: The priority of the order. Setting a high priority value for some orders will tend as much as possible to have them included in the solution over lower-priority orders.

oneOf.description: The size of the order (quantities for delivery). You can specify size in any dimension, such as weight, volume, or quantity. You can even specify multiple dimensions, for example, weight and volume. For example: "quantity":10, "quantity":{"weight":10,"volume":20}

service_duration.description: The duration of the service (service time) in seconds, i.e. how long it takes at the customer site.

time_windows.description: The time windows of the order. Vehicles must visit a location within its time windows.

earliest.description: The earliest time of the window for a visit the location (seconds).

latest.description: The latest time of the window for a visit the location (seconds).

earliest_start.description: Earliest start time of the break (seconds)

latest_start.description: Latest start time of the break (seconds)

optional.description: true if the break is optional(the break can be performed or unperformed); otherwise, false(the break must be performed mandatory).

oneOf.description: End of the vehicle route. Format: "\<lat\>,\<lng\>" or "\<depot_id\>".
Start of the vehicle route. Format: "\<lat\>,\<lng\>" or "\<depot_id\>".

id.description: The depot identifier. By default id is assigned in the format "depots[\<index\]>", for example: "depots[0]", "depots[1]", ...

max_vehicle_driving_duration.description: Vehicle maximum route driving duration (seconds). Not include service or wait times. Default: 0 (Unlimited)

max_vehicle_orders.description: Maximum allowable number of orders on the vehicle. Default: 0 (Unlimited)

max_vehicle_waiting_duration.description: Vehicle maximum waiting duration at order (seconds). Default: 0 (Unlimited)

start_time.description: Start time (seconds since 01/01/1970 00:00:00 or seconds since 01/01/0001 00:00:00 or 0 - current time in UTC). Default: 0 (UTC Now)

id.description: The vehicle identifier. By default id is assigned in the format "vehicles[\<index\]>", for example: "vehicles[0]", "vehicles[1]", ...

max_orders.description: Maximum allowable number of orders on the vehicle

Extended Delivery.description: Complex Delivery with multidimensional capacity constraints, distance and duration constraints, time windows, working hours, breaks, ...
